alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Franklin; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:23PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pittsylvania, southern Bedford and southeastern Franklin Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 222 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rocky Mount, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount... Penhook... Sago... Smith Mountain Lake State Park... Western Smith Mountain Lake... Union Hall... and Sontag. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
